title: Event Catering Delivery Coordination
content: A catering company operates from multiple regional kitchens (<loc_depot>) to supply freshly prepared meals to event venues (<loc_customer>). Each venue requires deliveries to arrive precisely within a time window (<time_windows>) to coincide with event start times. Catering trucks have a maximum load capacity (<capacity> kg) for meal boxes, and drivers must return to their origin depot within an 8-hour shift (<duration_limit>). The challenge is to route trucks efficiently to meet all time constraints, avoid overloading vehicles, and minimize total travel distance while ensuring every event receives its order exactly once.

content: A city’s sanitation department manages multiple waste collection depots (<loc_depot>) to service residential neighborhoods (<loc_customer>). The goal is to design routes from each depot that respect time windows, prevent overloading, and reduce total mileage while ensuring every bin is emptied within its allocated timeframe.

title: Medical Lab Sample Collection Network

Vehicles have limited cold-storage capacity (<capacity> liters) and must return to their origin lab within 6 hours (<duration_limit>) to preserve sample integrity. The task is to plan efficient routes that meet all time constraints, avoid exceeding storage limits, and minimize travel distance while ensuring every clinic is serviced once.
